best_match.title: Like Spinning Plates (‘Why Us?’ Version) - Radiohead Legendado PT-BR Incendies Movie

match_score.reasoning: Candidate 4 is the best match because it explicitly links the correct song, 'Like Spinning Plates' by Radiohead, to the movie 'Incendies' in both its title and description. The description also correctly identifies the album 'Amnesiac', which contains the studio version of the song used in the movie. While it is a fan-uploaded video and not an official release, its direct contextual relevance to the movie soundtrack makes it superior for this specific task compared to other candidates that either feature the wrong song, a live version without movie context, or an official track that is a different version of 'Spinning Plates'.
key_factors: Video title explicitly includes 'Like Spinning Plates', 'Radiohead', and 'Incendies Movie'.
Video description confirms 'Radiohead' as the artist and 'Amnesiac' as the album, which is correct for the studio version of the song used in the movie.
Video description explicitly mentions 'Imagens do filme Incêndios' (Images from the movie Incendies), confirming the visual context.
It is the only candidate that directly connects the correct song and artist to the specified movie.
concerns: The video is a fan upload, not an official music video or audio track from Radiohead or their label.

The video has relatively low views and likes compared to official topic channel uploads, which might indicate it's not the most canonical version of the song itself, but it is the most relevant for the movie soundtrack context.

search_query: You and Whose Army? Radiohead Incendies

match_score.reasoning: Candidate 1 is the best match because it features the exact song title 'Nami Nami' and is performed by Azam Ali, whose rendition of this song is famously and widely recognized as being featured in the movie 'Incendies'. Although the video description does not explicitly mention the movie 'Incendies', the video is an official upload from Six Degrees Records, Azam Ali's record label, ensuring high authenticity and quality. Its high view and like counts further suggest it is the canonical version of the song. The other candidates either feature different songs from the 'Incendies' soundtrack (Candidates 2, 4, 5) or are a less official/popular live version of 'Nami Nami' (Candidate 3) without the crucial movie context.
key_factors: Performer (Azam Ali) is the artist whose version is used in the movie 'Incendies'
High authenticity, uploaded by the official record label (Six Degrees Records)
High popularity (views and likes) indicating it is the widely accepted version of the song
concerns: The video description does not explicitly mention the movie 'Incendies' or that it is from the movie's soundtrack, requiring external knowledge to confirm the movie connection.
